column1: Bad Zwischenahn  (Low German: Twüschenahn) is a town and a municipality in the low-lying Ammerland district
column3: Germany. It is on Zwischenahner Meer
column4: approximately 15 km northwest of Oldenburg and about 70 km south of the North Sea coast.

column1: During World War II Bad Zwischenahn was home to the largest Luftwaffe airbase in northern Germany
column2: with first the Erprobungskommando 16 service-test unit
column3: then Jagdgeschwader 400 each in their turn operating the Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet rocket fighter from the base. The airbase was heavily bombed. After the war
column4: the airbase was converted to a golf course.

column2: the food industry (sausage and ham production)
column3: and resort community services for the well to do urban population of Oldenburg and Bremen. The lake is used for boating

column1: One of the premier sites for tourists is a windmill originally built in  1811 in Westerstede. It is part of a historical museum farm consisting of 14 houses and auxiliary buildings that were moved to their today's location from 1909 to 2004.
